verses.esv:
9   The heart of man plans his way,
    but the LORD establishes his steps.
verses.kjv: 9 A man’s heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
verses.niv: 9 In his heart a man plans his course, but the LORD determines his steps.

verses.esv: 13 Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go into such and such a town and spend a year there and trade and make a profit”—14 yet you do not know what tomorrow will bring. What is your life? For you are a mist that appears for a little time and then vanishes. 15 Instead you ought to say, “If the Lord wills, we will live and do this or that.” 16 As it is, you boast in your arrogance. All such boasting is evil. 17 So whoever knows the right thing to do and fails to do it, for him it is sin.
verses.kjv: 13 Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain: 14 Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away. 15 For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that. 16 But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil. 17 Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.
verses.niv: 13 Now listen, you who say, "Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city, spend a year there, carry on business and make money." 14 Why, you do not even know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? You are a mist that appears for a little while and then vanishes. 15 Instead, you ought to say, "If it is the Lord's will, we will live and do this or that." 16 As it is, you boast and brag. All such boasting is evil. 17 Anyone, then, who knows the good he ought to do and doesn't do it, sins.

verses.esv:
3   Commit your work to the LORD,
    and your plans will be established.
verses.kjv: 3 Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.niv: 3 Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and your plans will succeed.

verses.esv:
22   Without counsel plans fail,
    but with many advisers they succeed.
verses.kjv: 22 Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
verses.niv: 22 Plans fail for lack of counsel, but with many advisers they succeed.

verses.esv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
verses.kjv: 11 For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
verses.niv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.

verses.esv:
16:1   The plans of the heart belong to man,
    but the answer of the tongue is from the LORD.
verses.kjv: 1 The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.
verses.niv: 1 To man belong the plans of the heart, but from the LORD comes the reply of the tongue.

verses.esv:
21   Many are the plans in the mind of a man,
    but it is the purpose of the LORD that will stand.
verses.kjv: 21 There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.
verses.niv: 21 Many are the plans in a man's heart, but it is the LORD's purpose that prevails.

verses.esv:
5   The plans of the diligent lead surely to abundance,
    but everyone who is hasty comes only to poverty.
verses.kjv: 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
verses.niv: 5 The plans of the diligent lead to profit as surely as haste leads to poverty.

verses.esv:
5   “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you,
  and before you were born I consecrated you;
  I appointed you a prophet to the nations.”
verses.kjv: 5 Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations.
verses.niv: 5 "Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I set you apart; I appointed you as a prophet to the nations."

verses.esv:
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv:
23   I know, O LORD, that the way of man is not in himself,
    that it is not in man who walks to direct his steps.
verses.kjv: 23 O LORD, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
verses.niv: 23 I know, O LORD, that a man's life is not his own; it is not for man to direct his steps.

verses.esv: 28 For which of you, desiring to build a tower, does not first sit down and count the cost, whether he has enough to complete it?
verses.kjv: 28 For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?
verses.niv: 28 "Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Will he not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?

verses.esv:
7   “For the Lord GOD does nothing
    without revealing his secret
    to his servants the prophets.
verses.kjv: 7 Surely the Lord GOD will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants the prophets.
verses.niv: 7 Surely the Sovereign LORD does nothing without revealing his plan to his servants the prophets.

verses.esv:
5   Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv: 24 “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
verses.kjv: 24 No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.niv: 24 "No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money.

verses.esv: 10 For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.
verses.kjv: 10 For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God hath before ordained that we should walk in them.
verses.niv: 10 For we are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 6 And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ.
verses.kjv: 6 Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
verses.niv: 6 being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.

verses.esv:
A Song of Ascents. Of Solomon.

127:1   Unless the LORD builds the house,
    those who build it labor in vain.
  Unless the LORD watches over the city,
    the watchman stays awake in vain.
verses.kjv: 1 Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it: except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.
verses.niv: 1 Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain. Unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchmen stand guard in vain.

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv:
Nun

105   Your word is a lamp to my feet
    and a light to my path.
verses.kjv: 105 Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
verses.niv: 105 Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path.

verses.esv:
27   Prepare your work outside;
    get everything ready for yourself in the field,
    and after that build your house.
verses.kjv: 27 Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.
verses.niv: 27 Finish your outdoor work and get your fields ready; after that, build your house.

verses.esv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask God, who gives generously to all without reproach, and it will be given him.
verses.kjv: 5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.niv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, he should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to him.

verses.esv: 24 And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, 25 not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near.
verses.kjv: 24 And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
verses.niv: 24 And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds. 25 Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one another--and all the more as you see the Day approaching.
